_json.gridTitle: Mitochondrial Depletion Could Underlie the Energy Problems in Chronic Fatigue Syndrome - Health Rising
_json.description: It would take 32 hours for the ATP levels in the muscles of ME/CFS patients to return to normal after short but intense (30 secs.) periods of exercise. Adding another exercise bout before recovery could occur would add substantially more time to the recovery period.  Read more: Mitochondrial Depletion Could Underlie the Energy Problems in Chronic Fatigue Syndrome http://www.cortjohnson.org/blog/2015/05/26/mitochondrial-depletion-could-underly-energy-problems-in-chronic-fatigue-syndrome/
